citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The Indian runner duck enclosure had an accumulation of old food and feces on the ground substrate. The floor of the dry
enclosure is covered in artificial turf. The front portion of the turf closest to their accessible pool of water was covered in
old food waste and old fecal material. The old and accumulated waste had also attracted gnats, which were seen crawling
over and flying around this waste. A facility representative stated that the turf is occasionally taken off the enclosure floor
and cleaned; however, they did not know the last time this occurred. Old food and feces can lead to the contamination of
the animals, may cause illness in the animals or create odors, and could attract pests which could cause stress and/or
lead to the spread of disease. Excreta and food waste must be removed from the primary enclosures and from under and
around primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces and food waste. Correct by
September 3, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.158(a)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The Indian runner duck enclosure had an accumulation of old food and feces on the ground substrate. The floor of the dry 
enclosure is covered in artificial turf. The front portion of the turf closest to their accessible pool of water was covered in 
old food waste and old fecal material. The old and accumulated waste had also attracted gnats, which were seen crawling 
over and flying around this waste. A facility representative stated that the turf is occasionally taken off the enclosure floor 
and cleaned; however, they did not know the last time this occurred. Old food and feces can lead to the contamination of 
the animals, may cause illness in the animals or create odors, and could attract pests which could cause stress and/or 
lead to the spread of disease. Excreta and food waste must be removed from the primary enclosures and from under and 
around primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces and food waste. Correct by 
September 3, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
